original: “bhante nāgasena, atthi koci mato na paṭisandahatī”ti.
analyzed: bhante nāgasena atthi koci mataḥ na paṭisandahati iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, is there anyone who has died and does not take rebirth?”

analyzed: koci paṭisandahati koci na paṭisandahati iti
kaḥ paṭisandahati kaḥ na paṭisandahati iti
sa kilesaḥ mahā rāja paṭisandahati nikkilesaḥ na paṭisandahati iti
translated: “One who is defiled, sire, takes rebirth, one who is not defiled does not.”

analyzed: tvam pana bhante nāgasena paṭisandahissasi iti
translated: “But, revered Nāgasena, will you take rebirth?”

original: “Sace, mahārāja, saupādāno bhavissāmi paṭisandahissāmi, sace anupādāno bhavissāmi na paṭisandahissāmī”ti.
analyzed: sace mahā rāja sa aupādānaḥ bhavissāmi paṭisandahissāmi sace anupādānaḥ bhavissāmi na paṭisandahissāmi iti
translated: “If, sire, I am one who has clinging I shall take rebirth; if I am one who has no clinging I shall not take rebirth.”
